Module com.andrei.pt_30424_pelle_andrei_assignment_4
Package com.andrei.DataAccess

Class Serializer<T>

java.lang.Object
com.andrei.DataAccess.Serializer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - -> type parameter to be serialized for lists. Can be client or menuItem.
public class Serializer<T> extends Object
This class serializes all the information about the application.

  • Method Details

    • readFromFile

      public List<T> readFromFile()
      Serializes T from a file with name "Ts.dat". Calls the read object method in a while loop until the end of file is reached. Should any exceptions happen, the list will be returned empty.
      Returns:
      a list of objects read from the serialized file

    • writeToFile

      public void writeToFile(List<T> toWrite)
      This method serializes all the data from the list to a file with name "Ts.dat". An object output stream is used, and each object is written with the toWrite method. Should an error occur, application data will not be serialized to the file
      Parameters:
      toWrite - -> list of T to be serialized

    • writeHashMap

      public static void writeHashMap(HashMap<Order,ArrayList<MenuItem>> toWrite)
      This method serializes a hashmap. Because the map is not a child of collection, a special method is required in order to serialize it. Thankfully, HashMap is serializable, so a single call to write object is enough to complete the serialization.
      Parameters:
      toWrite - -> hashmap to serialize

    • readHashMap

      public static HashMap<Order,ArrayList<MenuItem>> readHashMap()
      This method will read the order details hash map from a file. A single call to read object is enough to get all the data, unlike when working with a list.
      Returns:
      serialized hash map of order details
